intro: Draconia saposhnikovii, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or tundra-like environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
